intro: Spilanthes ciliata var. diffusa, commonly known as the hairy pungent cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and hairy, pungent leaves that emit a strong odor when crushed. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Due to its unique appearance and chemical properties, it is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent.
